intro: Eleocharis elata, commonly known as the slender spike-rush, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in wetlands, marshes, and along the edges of ponds and lakes. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spike-like clusters. Its rhizomes help it spread vegetatively, making it a common component of aquatic and semi-aquatic ecosystems. Eleocharis elata plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various aquatic organisms.
